ai.summary: A 5.5 km easy circular coastal walk from Heddon’s Mouth, offering scenic cliff-top views, river gorge scenery and a family-friendly route along a UK coastline.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal paths with a mix of gravel tracks, grassy lanes and some uneven sections. Expect short flights of steps and muddy patches after rain. Some stretches run close to exposed cliff edges; keep children and dogs under control.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and tide conditions before setting out; stay on marked paths near cliffs; wear sturdy footwear; bring waterproof clothing and a layer; carry water and snacks; mobile signal may be weak in remote sections; supervise children closely; be mindful of livestock and gates; after heavy rain, routes can be muddy and slippery.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layered) and a waterproof jacket
Map or GPS device (or offline map on phone)
Whistle and charged phone for emergencies
ai.best_seasons: All year; spring to autumn typically offer the best weather and sea views, while winter visits require warmer clothing and careful footing due to wind and mud.
